title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ATLANTA (AP) — On a night where points were a premium and defenses reigned, one man staged a historic offensive clinic. Dominique Wilkins, the human highlight film himself, turned back the clock and authored a performance for the ages, pouring in a staggering 42 points to single-handedly dismantle the Toronto Raptors in a 101-75 Hawks rout.

In an era defined by grit, Wilkins’s explosion was a brilliant anomaly. While both teams struggled to find an offensive rhythm, ‘Nique was a symphony of scoring efficiency. The final box score, showing a combined 176 points, belies the sheer dominance of one player against the tide. The Hawks’ victory was not a team effort; it was a coronation.

Wilkins was relentless, attacking from every conceivable angle. Whether draining jumpers from the elbow or throwing down his signature thunderous dunks in transition, the Raptors had no answer. Each basket chipped away at Toronto’s spirit, turning a defensive struggle into a one-man showcase. The Atlanta Arena crowd, witnessing something special, rose with every possession, fueling their legend as he piled points onto the board.

The rest of the game faded into a supporting role for Wilkins’s masterpiece. Steve Smith’s 13 points and 8 assists were a quiet compliment, while Christian Laettner’s 14 rebounds cleaned up the rare misses. For the overmatched Raptors, Doug Christie’s 13 points were a mere footnote against the onslaught.

In the record books, this will go down as a 26-point Hawks win. But for those who witnessed it, this night belonged solely to Dominique Wilkins. It was a breathtaking reminder of his unparalleled scoring prowess, a vintage performance where one legendary force was simply too much for an entire team to handle.
